cards.rules_text:
Impending 3—{2}{W}{W} [i](If this spell was impending, it enters with three time counters and isn't a creature until they're removed. At the beginning of your end step, remove one.)[/i]
First strike, trample
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may exile it, then return it to the battlefield under its owner's control.

You may search your library for a green creature card with mana value X or less, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle.
Create a token that's a copy of a creature you control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Life will persist, no matter what form it must take.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker if it has mana value 2 or less. If your history in black is six or greater, instead destroy that permanent if it has mana value 4 or less. [i](Your history in black is the number of {B} symbols in mana costs in your graveyard.)[/i]

Whenever this creature enters or attacks, you gain 1 life and surveil 1.
This creature has flying as long as your history in white is six or greater. [i](Your history in white is the number of {W} symbols in mana costs in your graveyard.)[/i]

Enchant creature
At the start of combat on your turn, create a token that's a copy of enchanted creature, except it's not legendary and it has lifelink and haste. Sacrifice that token at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Why could I only muster up this courage after losing everything?”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Impending 4—{3} [i](If this spell was impending, it enters with four time counters and isn't a creature until they're removed. At the beginning of your end step, remove one.)[/i]
Vigilance, trample, haste, ward {3}

As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature unless your history in black is six or greater. [i](Your history in black is the number of {B} symbols in mana costs in your graveyard.)[/i]
At the beginning of your first main phase, you draw a card and lose 1 life.
Draw two cards. You lose 3 life unless your history in black is six or greater. [i](Your history in black is the number of {B} symbols in mana costs in your graveyard.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]It gets easier once they already have your soul.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature or planeswalker, discards a card, and loses 3 life. You draw a card and gain 3 life.

cards.rules_text:
When Crescendo enters, draw two cards.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, surveil 1 and put a cadence counter on Crescendo. 
Remove seven counters from Crescendo: You may cast the next spell you cast from your hand this turn without paying its mana cost.

cards.special_text:
[i](As this Saga enters and after your draw step, add a lore counter. Sacrifice after III.)[/i]
I — Create a 1/1 blue Human Scout creature token with vigilance.
Mill four cards.
II — Each instant and sorcery spell in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost plus sacrifice a creature.

cards.rules_text: When this creature enters, tap target creature you don't control and put a stun counter on it. That creature loses all abilities for as long as it remains tapped.

Once on each of your turns, you may cast a creature spell from your hand with mana value lesser than or equal to the total number of artifacts and enchantments you control without paying its mana cost.

Deathtouch, haste
When this creature dies, you may sacrifice another creature. If you do, return this creature to the battlefield tapped under your control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor_text: [i]And so they took all there was to take.[/i]
[i]Under the cruel glare of efflorescence, the heart of the industrial district became a great bubbling mass.[/i]
[i]The day clawed and tore and ripped at its flesh, but all that lay beneath was cold twilight. [/i]
[i]And then the air became still as death.[/i]
[i]Facing efflorescence in the outskirts leads to the great wall that separates what is from what is not.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}: Add {B}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Commercial and residential districts use more land space than any other, with these being frequently monitored for efflorescent blooms.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}: Add {U}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Research districts have well-furnished apartments, with the nearby ocean serving as a dumping ground for larger bloom material. [/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}: Add {G}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Small sections are often reserved for culture districts, though the advent of efflorescence means their dwindling funding often suffers further as more extreme measures are enacted.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}: Add {W}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Offices of the outer districts tend to be more spacious. Lower population density decreases the risk from efflorescence events, but outskirts breaches are not unheard of.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}: Add {R}
cards.flavor_text: [i]The industrial district lies in the lower layers of a city, where the relative safety is balanced by grueling work and sweltering heat.[/i]

You get a flare counter. [i](If a source you control would deal noncombat damage, you may pay X flare counters to have it deal that much damage plus X instead.)[/i]
cards.notes: msem change to hit any target

cards.rules_text:
Flying
Artifacts and creatures your opponents control enter tapped.

Creatures you control can't be blocked as long as you've put a +1/+1 counter on them this turn.
{3}{U}{U}: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put a noncreature card revealed this way into your hand, and put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.

Whenever a player mills one or more land cards, create a tapped Treasure token. This ability triggers only once each turn.
Whenever a player mills one or more nonland, noncreature cards, draw a card. This ability triggers only once each turn.

When this enchantment enters, you get two flare counters. [i](If a source you control would deal noncombat damage, you may pay X flare counters to have it deal that much damage plus X instead.)[/i]
Whenever you pay one or more flare counters, exile the top card of your library. You may play that card until your next end step.

Enchanted creatures you control have ward {1} and trample.
Whenever you sacrifice an Aura, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature that Aura was attached to.

Infuse 1 [i](Whenever you cast or copy a noncreature spell, if this creature has no +1/+1 counters on it, put one on it.)[/i]
Once each turn, whenever you put one or more +1/+1 counters on this creature, untap up to two target lands.
Mystic Torrent deals damage equal to the amount of mana spent to cast it to target creature or planeswalker. When it deals five or more damage this way, add {R}{R}{R}{R}{R}.

Haste
Whenever this creature attacks, you may sacrifice an artifact. If you do, this creature deals 2 damage to the defending player.
cards.flavor_text: [i]As a fragment of the soul, efflorescent tools manifest differently for each user.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
At the beginning of your first main phase, choose up to one target creature card from your graveyard. Copy it. You may cast that copy.
Whenever a creature you control enters, each opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.

Target player chooses X creatures they control. You gain control of those creatures until end of turn. Untap them.
Creatures you control get +1/+0 and gain trample and haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“To seek freedom is to pierce. Strike with no hesitation.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When you cast this spell, return each card named Lurking Absolution from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Haste
Whenever this creature attacks, mill four cards.

When this enchantment enters, if it was cast, untap each nonland permanent you control.
Once each turn, whenever you cast a creature spell with mana value 5 or greater, you may draw a card.

Trample
When this creature dies, if it's a creature, return it to the battlefield as an enchantment artifact with “{3}, {T}: You may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield. That creature gains haste. Sacrifice the creature at the beginning of the next end step.”
Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, create a colorless Equipment artifact token named Sword with “Equipped creature gets +1/+1” and equip {2} attached to that creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Bloodforged Weaponry is inexpensive, but brittle and temperamental.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Create a Clue token. [i](It's an artifact with “{2}, Sacrifice this artifact: Draw a card.”)[/i]
{1}{UB}, Pay 2 life, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create two Clue tokens. Activate only if you control no Clues.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I write with the concern our current knowledge of demonology may be incomplete. Enclosed with this letter is proof of anomalous behavior.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, create a 1/1 red and blue Reflection creature token.
{UR}, Sacrifice three Reflections: The next time you cast a noncreature spell this turn, copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy.
cards.flavor_text: [i]I am at the center of everything that happens to me.[/i]

Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
